Mutations in any of the genes listed above cause the resulting protein to be continuously active, rather than switching on and off in response to cell signals. This constant activation disrupts the regulation of systems that control cell growth and division, leading to the characteristic features of Noonan syndrome.",GHR,Noonan syndrome
Is Noonan syndrome inherited ?,"This condition is inherited in an autosoma
